Frank you right as far as personal e-mail for personal disagreement. 
but =
I have noticed you on more than one occasion with a more than healthy dose =
of personal opinion on this board.
And forget that fear analogy this has no=
thing to do with fear, it has to do with common sense practices in this res=
earch.
 
 
 
Lets not start another negative run. PLEASE!
I won't respond t=
o anything else regarding this matter.
 
bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.comFrom: warrior18eii@...: Mon, 14 Jan 2008 06:20:0=
4 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: PROTECTION RITUAL FILE POSTED






There=
 is no reason to think anyone is being a hypocrite here. If this research h=
as taught us anything it teaches us that changing what we believe and chang=
es in our perspective are constant. The things we pretend we know are const=
antly challenged by the things we learn from the contacts we make. The more=
 experience in ITC we have (positive or negative) the more it reinforces th=
e acceptance of no fear.Now with that being said, if Bruce and Steve want t=
o take this conversation to the negative and make it an argument then do it=
 in private email. It is not anyone else's business if you have a "bone to =
pick" with each other.Regards,Frank R.
----- Original Message ----From: bru=
ce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...>To: evp-itc@...=
mSent: Monday, January 14, 2008 7:57:13 AMSubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: PROTEC=
TION RITUAL FILE POSTED

Steve, At the risk of starting a big critical stri=
ng of postsyou forget that you and I experienced the negative side of this =
researchtogether and you even went as far as to do a cleansing ritual invol=
ving a medium. And have told me on numerous occasions that you do a protect=
ion ritual before every session.All I can say is that if you where not bein=
g truthful, that is why you experienced the negative incidents that plagued=
 your home and your research.  Please, and I'm asking nicely do not take th=
e road of hypocrisy just to disagree with me.It would not be fare to the ne=
w individuals that may trust your opinion. I do not try or presume to tell =
anyone one what they do or do not have to do, and if Ipresent my opinion th=
at way I apologize to all. I only try to offer my experienced opinion as yo=
u do. Steve, lets not start these insinuating posts back and forth, lets re=
main civil and friendly for the sake of the research. And to any and all th=
at read this post the protection ritual is just another diverse tool in our=
 researchtool box, there to use if you personally feel it's necessary. Stev=
e and I have taken different paths as far as research ideas are concerned a=
nd felt it would bemore beneficial to us both and to the research on a whol=
e if we pursued individual avenues of research as apposed to a research col=
laboration.If some of the ripples from this have reached this forum I for o=
ne apologise and will do my best to keep my posts to a civiland professiona=
l level. Bruce  
Bruce Halliday 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .comFrom: urkel23@=
aol. comDate: Mon, 14 Jan 2008 11:54:09 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: PROTECT=
ION RITUAL FILE POSTED


I agree Frank, i don't do the protection thing. Ye=
t, i did have a couple problems here personally. I guess for people who bel=
ieve in it i guess it couldn't hurt, as for my problems i can't say it was =
from not doing a protection prayer but i also can't say it was. Another par=
anormal toss up for each researcher to decide i guess. That's why i never t=
ell anyone what to do, there is no right and wrong way to do anything in th=
is field. People just have to draw conclusions on their own and get results=
 in the way that they seem fit. And than report, and not tell people for a =
fact that it should be done that way. Each person with their own ideas will=
 eventually put all the pieces to this paranormal puzzle together.-Steve H.=
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@ ...> wrote=
:>> Bad idea! In my opinion. You just create fear with that crap, and > fea=
r feeds itself. Once again, you will create what you expect to > get. If yo=
u use protection BS, you'll have convinced yourself that > there is somethi=
ng to be affraid of, and so you will tend to creat a > thoughtform to fulfi=
ll that expectation.> > Frank-S> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "bhal=
i333" > <paranormalinvestig ating@> wrote:> >> > everyone,> > > > I have wr=
itten up the short protection ritual I use before every > > session, I have=
 been using it for quite a while now and have had no > > problems with dark=
 heads other than the occasional curse word.> > > > I recommend that all re=
searchers experienced and new use this or a > > similar protection ritual b=
efore every box session if you are not > > already. > > > > hey it's better=
 to have it and not need it , than need it and not > have > > it!> > > > I =
will post it in the files section in a folder marked > > "protection ritual=
"> > > > Thanks guy's> > > > Bruce> >>Get the power of Windows + Web with t=
he new Windows Live. Get it now! 

Never miss a thing. Make Yahoo your home=
page.
